total bytes sent, including 12-byte RTP headers
total bytes sent, not including RTP headers

entries.syntax:
aligned(8) class hintmaxrate extends Box('maxr') {	// maximum data rate
	uint(32)	period;			// in milliseconds
	uint(32)	bytes; }			// max bytes sent in any period 'period' long
									//  including RTP headers

entries.description: hint media header, overall information (hint track only)
media header, overall information about the media
container for the media information in a track
entries.syntax:
aligned(8) class MediaBox extends Box('mdia') {
}

aligned(8) class MetaBox (handler_type)
	extends FullBox('meta', version = 0, 0) {
	HandlerBox(handler_type)	theHandler;
	PrimaryItemBox		primary_resource;		// optional
	DataInformationBox	file_locations;		// optional
	ItemLocationBox		item_locations;		// optional
	ItemProtectionBox	protections;			// optional
	ItemInfoBox			item_infos;				// optional
	IPMPControlBox		IPMP_control;			// optional
	ItemReferenceBox		item_refs;					// optional
	ItemDataBox			item_data;					// optional
	Box	other_boxes[];								// optional
}

aligned(8) class MediaInformationBox extends Box('minf') {
}

aligned(8) class MovieExtendsBox extends Box('mvex'){
}

entries.description: Null media header, overall information (some tracks only)

entries.syntax:
aligned(8) class OriginalFileTypeBox extends Box('otyp') {
}

flags.name: encoder_input_output
flags.description: UTC time represents the frame's input (0) or output (1) time for the encoder.

flags.name: finalization_time
flags.description: UTC time is when the MovieFragmentBox was finalized; media_time is set to the earliest frame's presentation time.

flags.name: file_write_time
flags.description: UTC time is when the MovieFragmentBox was written to file; media_time is set to the earliest frame's presentation time.

flags.name: arbitrary_association
flags.description: Association between media_time and UTC time is arbitrary but consistent within the track.

flags.name: realtime_offset
flags.description: UTC time has a consistent, small offset from the real-time experience depicted at media_time.
